name: Portals
description: Creates linked spatial gateways that allow instant travel between two flat surfaces.
restrictions: Can only be placed on portal-conductive surfaces.
Cannot be placed on moving surfaces, glass, metal, or sloped walls.

name: Portal Gun
description: The handheld portal device used to fire blue and orange portals.

name: Weighted Storage Cube
description: Used to hold down buttons or be placed to solve puzzles.

name: Buttons
description: Activates doors or other mechanisms when pressed.

name: Doors
description: Gateways that open or close based on logic triggers.

name: High Energy Pellet
description: A bouncing energy sphere that travels until it hits a receptacle or disintegrates.
lifespan: Timed, despawns after a few seconds if not caught

name: Energy Pellet Receptor
description: A device that receives the high energy pellet to activate mechanisms.

name: Timed Switches
description: Buttons or triggers that activate something for a limited time.

name: Lifts / Platforms
description: Moving platforms that transport the player or objects across gaps.

name: Turrets
description: Autonomous enemy units that shoot at the player on sight.

name: Emancipation Grill
description: A force field that prevents objects from passing through and deletes unauthorized items.

name: Cameras
description: Wall-mounted observation devices used by GLaDOS to monitor the player.

name: Radio
description: Easter egg object added in Portal update for ARG.

name: Logic Gates (Internal)
description: Used internally to process logic between switches, buttons, and outputs.

name: Momentum Transfer
description: Conservation of momentum mechanic where falling into a portal can launch the player out of the other.

name: Flinging
description: A technique that uses portals and momentum to traverse vertical or horizontal distances.

name: Observation Rooms
description: Rooms behind glass used for visual narrative and atmosphere.

name: GLaDOS Voice Lines
description: Narrative voiceovers triggered by player progress or actions.
